description: From Middle French neutralité, from Medieval Latin neutralitas.

entries.meaning: The state or quality of being neutral; the condition of being unengaged in contests between others; state of taking no part on either side.
examples: Men who possess a state of neutrality in times of public danger, desert the interest of their fellow subjects.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Indifference in quality; a state neither very good nor bad.
examples: There is no health; physicians say that we At best enjoy but a neutrality.

entries.meaning: (chemistry): The quality or state of being neutral.
(international law) The condition of a nation or government which refrains from taking part, directly or indirectly, in a war between other powers.
Those who are neutral; a combination of neutral powers or states.
